dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 6503 IH: Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2023, Part II
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Graves of Missouri (for himself and Mr. Larsen of Washington) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committees on Ways and Means, and Science, Space, and Technology, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to extend authorizations for the airport improvement program, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the funding and expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2023, Part II.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 102. Extension of expiring authorities; miscellaneous authorizations.
Sec. 104. Air navigation facilities and equipment.
Sec. 201. Expenditure authority from Airport and Airway Trust Fund.
Sec. 202. Extension of taxes funding Airport and Airway Trust Fund.

subsection.text: Section 48103(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended by striking paragraph (7) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: $1,464,480,874 for the period beginning October 1, 2023, and ending on March 8, 2024.

subsection.text: Subject to limitations specified in advance in appropriation Acts, sums made available pursuant to the amendment made by subsection (a) may be obligated at any time through September 30, 2024, and shall remain available until expended.

For purposes of calculating funding apportionments and meeting other requirements under sections 47114, 47115, 47116, and 47117 of title 49, United States Code, for the period beginning on October 1, 2023, and ending on March 8, 2024, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall—

paragraph.text: first calculate such funding apportionments on an annualized basis as if the total amount available under section 48103 of such title for fiscal year 2024 was $3,350,000,000; and

subparagraph.text: all funding apportionment amounts calculated under paragraph (1); and
amounts made available pursuant to subsections (b) and (f)(2) of section 47117 of such title.

subsection.text: Section 47104(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended in the matter preceding paragraph (1) by striking December 31, 2023, and inserting March 8, 2024,.

subsection.header: Extension of special rule for apportionments

subsection.text: Section 9502(d)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

in subparagraph (A) by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting or the Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2023, Part II;.
